item.title: Emacs macros
item.description: How to use macros Emacs ways: C-x ( to start recording macro C-x ) to stop recording macro C-x e to execute the last macro defined M-x name-last-kbd-macro to name last defined macro M-x insert-kbd-macro to save named macro (copy result to .

item.title: Subset DT
item.description: Subsetting data.table can be done using base R subset with S3 Class for data.table object. Alternatively is to use the recode approach as mentioned in StackOverflow. lookup <- list(v1 = 1:3, v2 = letters[5:7]) DT[lookup, on = names(lookup), nomatch = NULL] This will return all columns in DT that match lookup list.

item.title: CI/CD and Code Coverage
item.description: First published date: 2021-06-04 A simple guide to use CI/CD and Code coverage. CI/CD This is a simple process to implement CI/CD using GitHub Actions with usethis package. Basically the steps here is a summary from Dean Attali with slight changes:

item.title: Rujukan Awam Git dan Github
item.description: Global setting Buat git repo dan R pakej Kopi branch di github ke lokal Kopi branch tertentu cara lain Log commit Tidak dapat kesan email Buat kekunci SSH dan daftarkan di Github Pelbagai akaun Permission denied ssh-agent refused operation Buat Repo melalui terminal Padam branch Git Aliases Undo atau Revert Sekiranya ada konflik Release atau tag Buat gh-page git config Global setting Tetapkan email dan nama di global.

item.title: Mount drive
item.description: Install Mount manually Credential Auto mount Other option to mount Execute Access to folders First published date: 2021-02-22 This is only relevant to my personal reference at work. The address for drive F and N is as follow: F: = \\fhi.

item.title: Good to know
item.description: Updated: 2022-04-12 Things that I find it useful during my work: Debuging warnings Sometimes it’s nice to know where in the code that generate warnings especially when it’s related to NA introduced by coercion. To do this we can change the options to make warning as error.

item.title: YesNo question
item.description: Different ways to make your R session interactive for asking question and receive the answer as an input. readline You can find some example in StackOverflow or Geeksforgeeks. Basically is just like this: cp <- as.integer(readline(prompt = "Vil du kopiere filen?

item.title: Cross-reference
item.description: Reference to this is here. Section link The easierst is to use CUSTOM_ID as the example below and refer to it with text [[#sec:one][Section 1]] or reference with number only [[#sec:one]]. * Section One :PROPERTIES: :CUSTOM_ID: sec:one :END: The link with text will be '.

item.title: Smerge, ediff and diff
item.description: First published: 2021-04-30 For enditing conflict in git, use smerge or ediff. Smerge Basic workflow: Open magit status with SPC g g in Doom Identify the mark with Unmerged under Unstage list Go to the file and press Enter to open the file The base command for Smerge is C-c ^ You will see the conflict and selecting the upper with C-c ^ u and lower with C-c ^ l To select all ‘conflicting’ changes press C-c ^ a To navigate the conflicts use C-c ^ n and C-c ^ p for next and previous conflict To see all the keybindings use C-c ^ h With DOOM and hydra:

item.title: Environment
item.description: Updated: 2022-04-12 Several nice blogs and references on the net to read on this stuff. Among those: Environments in R How R Searches and Finds Stuff This discussion from StackOverflow and here explains nicely with example on the difference between parent.
